alert.note: Alert for Cache Valley, Utah Portion; Eastern Box Elder County; Northern Wasatch Front; Salt Lake Valley; Tooele and Rush Valleys (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 12 at 3:50PM MST until January 15 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulation through Saturday morning 2 to 6 inches. An additional 3 to 6 inches, with locally up to 12 inches is expected Saturday afternoon through Monday morning for the Salt Lake and Tooele alleys. An additional 5 to 10 inches with locally up to 14 inches is expected for the northern Wasatch Front, eastern Box Elder County and the Cache Valley. * WHERE...Tooele and Rush Valleys, Eastern Box Elder County, Northern Wasatch Front, Salt Lake Valley and Cache Valley/Utah Portion. * WHEN...From 11 AM this morning to 5 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions can be expected across many routes Friday afternoon into Saturday morning, potentially impacting the Friday evening commute. Blowing and drifting snow is expected along I-15 and I-84 from the Tremonton area to the Idaho border. Another round of snow will bring the potential for winter driving conditions Saturday afternoon into Monday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow may mix with rain at times along valley floors Saturday evening into Sunday morning, especially across Salt Lake and Utah Valleys. Anywhere this occurs will see a reduction in snow totals.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov.
